answerText: treees [10] In contrast to Kruskal's algorithm, this other greedy minimum spanning tree algorithm works on connected graphs. It grows the solution tree by repeatedly adding the lowest -weight edge which connects a vertex that is not already part of the solution.
heading: VCU Closed  |2013 | Chicago A + Illinois B  | 11 | Science | Computer Science | College
subject: Science
question: Question: One major task of compilers is to generate a parse version of these objects, while pruning is often used on search ones. For 10 points each: [10] Name these ubiquitous data structures, minimum spanning examples of which are produced by Kruskal's algorithm, and which also come in binary search, AVL, and Red-Black varieties.
